Package com.jme.bullet.objects

Class VehicleWheel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme.bullet.objects.VehicleWheel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jme.export.Savable
    public class VehicleWheel
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.jme.export.Savable
    Information about one wheel of a PhysicsVehicle.
    Author:
    normenhansen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected com.jme.math.Vector3f axle
      axis direction (in chassis coordinates, typically to the right/-1,0,0)
      protected com.jme.math.Vector3f direction
      suspension direction (in chassis coordinates, typically down/0,-1,0)
      protected float frictionSlip
      copy of coefficient of friction between tyre and ground (0.8→realistic car, 10000→kart racer, default=10.5)
      protected boolean frontWheel
      copy of wheel type: true→front (steering) wheel, false→non-front wheel
      protected com.jme.math.Vector3f location
      location where the suspension connects to the chassis (in chassis coordinates)
      protected float maxSuspensionForce
      copy of maximum force exerted by the suspension (default=6000)
      protected float maxSuspensionTravelCm
      copy of maximum suspension travel distance (in centimeters, default=500)
      protected float radius
      copy of wheel radius (in physics-space units, >0)
      protected float restLength
      copy of rest length of the suspension (in physics-space units)
      protected float rollInfluence
      copy of roll-influence factor (0→no roll torque, 1→realistic behavior, default=1)
      protected float suspensionStiffness
      copy of suspension stiffness constant (10→off-road buggy, 50→sports car, 200→Formula-1 race car, default=20)
      protected com.jme.math.Quaternion tmp_inverseWorldRotation  
      protected com.jme.math.Matrix3f tmp_Matrix  
      protected long wheelId
      unique identifier of the btRaycastVehicle
      protected int wheelIndex
      0-origin index among the vehicle's wheels (≥0)
      protected float wheelsDampingCompression
      copy of suspension damping when compressed (0→no damping, default=4.4)
      protected float wheelsDampingRelaxation
      copy of suspension damping when expanded (0→no damping, default=2.3)
      protected com.jme.scene.Spatial wheelSpatial
      associated spatial, or null if none
      protected com.jme.math.Vector3f wheelWorldLocation
      wheel location in physics-space coordinates
      protected com.jme.math.Quaternion wheelWorldRotation
      wheel orientation in physics-space coordinates

    • Constructor Detail

      • VehicleWheel

        public VehicleWheel()
        No-argument constructor needed by SavableClassUtil. Do not invoke directly!

      • VehicleWheel

        public VehicleWheel​(com.jme.scene.Spatial spat,
                    com.jme.math.Vector3f location,
                    com.jme.math.Vector3f direction,
                    com.jme.math.Vector3f axle,
                    float restLength,
                    float radius,
                    boolean frontWheel)
        Instantiate a wheel.
        Parameters:
        spat - the associated spatial, or null if none
        location - the location where the suspension connects to the chassis (in chassis coordinates, not null, unaffected)
        direction - the suspension direction (in chassis coordinates, not null, unaffected, typically down/0,-1,0)
        axle - the axis direction (in chassis coordinates, not null, unaffected, typically right/-1,0,0)
        restLength - the rest length of the suspension (in physics-space units)
        radius - the wheel's radius (in physics-space units, ≥0)
        frontWheel - true→front (steering) wheel, false→non-front wheel

      • VehicleWheel

        public VehicleWheel​(com.jme.math.Vector3f location,
                    com.jme.math.Vector3f direction,
                    com.jme.math.Vector3f axle,
                    float restLength,
                    float radius,
                    boolean frontWheel)
        Instantiate a wheel without an associated spatial.
        Parameters:
        location - the location where the suspension connects to the chassis (in chassis coordinates, not null, unaffected)
        direction - the suspension direction (in chassis coordinates, not null, unaffected, typically down/0,-1,0)
        axle - the axis direction (in chassis coordinates, not null, unaffected, typically right/-1,0,0)
        restLength - the rest length of the suspension (in physics-space units)
        radius - the wheel's radius (in physics-space units, ≥0)
        frontWheel - true→front (steering) wheel, false→non-front wheel

      • setSuspensionStiffness

        public void setSuspensionStiffness​(float suspensionStiffness)
        Alter the stiffness constant for this wheel's suspension.
        Parameters:
        suspensionStiffness - the desired stiffness constant (10→off-road buggy, 50→sports car, 200→Formula-1 race car, default=20)

      • getWheelsDampingRelaxation

        public float getWheelsDampingRelaxation()
        Read this wheel's damping when the suspension is expanded.
        Returns:
        the damping

      • setWheelsDampingRelaxation

        public void setWheelsDampingRelaxation​(float wheelsDampingRelaxation)
        Alter this wheel's damping when the suspension is expanded.

        Set to k * 2 * FastMath.sqrt(m_suspensionStiffness) where k is the damping ratio:

        k = 0.0 undamped and bouncy, k = 1.0 critical damping, k between 0.1 and 0.3 are good values

        Parameters:
        wheelsDampingRelaxation - the desired damping (default=2.3)

      • getWheelsDampingCompression

        public float getWheelsDampingCompression()
        Read this wheel's damping when the suspension is compressed.
        Returns:
        the damping

      • setWheelsDampingCompression

        public void setWheelsDampingCompression​(float wheelsDampingCompression)
        Alter this wheel's damping when the suspension is compressed.

        Set to k * 2 * FastMath.sqrt(m_suspensionStiffness) where k is the damping ratio:

        k = 0.0 undamped and bouncy, k = 1.0 critical damping, k between 0.1 and 0.3 are good values

        Parameters:
        wheelsDampingCompression - the desired damping (default=4.4)

      • getFrictionSlip

        public float getFrictionSlip()
        Read the friction between this wheel's tyre and the ground.
        Returns:
        the coefficient of friction

      • setFrictionSlip

        public void setFrictionSlip​(float frictionSlip)
        Alter the friction between this wheel's tyre and the ground.

        Should be about 0.8 for realistic cars, but can increased for better handling. Set large (10000.0) for kart racers.

        Parameters:
        frictionSlip - the desired coefficient of friction (default=10.5)

      • getRollInfluence

        public float getRollInfluence()
        Read this wheel's roll influence.
        Returns:
        the roll-influence factor

      • setRollInfluence

        public void setRollInfluence​(float rollInfluence)
        Alter this wheel's roll influence.

        The roll-influence factor reduces (or magnifies) the torque contributed by this wheel that tends to cause the vehicle to roll over. This is a bit of a hack, but it's quite effective.

        If the friction between the tyres and the ground is too high, you may reduce this factor to prevent the vehicle from rolling over. You should also try lowering the vehicle's centre of mass.

        Parameters:
        rollInfluence - the desired roll-influence factor (0→no roll torque, 1→realistic behaviour, default=1)

      • getMaxSuspensionTravelCm

        public float getMaxSuspensionTravelCm()
        Read the travel distance for this wheel's suspension.
        Returns:
        the maximum travel distance (in centimeters)

      • setMaxSuspensionTravelCm

        public void setMaxSuspensionTravelCm​(float maxSuspensionTravelCm)
        Alter the travel distance for this wheel's suspension.
        Parameters:
        maxSuspensionTravelCm - the desired maximum travel distance (in centimetres, default=500)

      • getMaxSuspensionForce

        public float getMaxSuspensionForce()
        Read the maximum force exerted by this wheel's suspension.
        Returns:
        the maximum force

      • setMaxSuspensionForce

        public void setMaxSuspensionForce​(float maxSuspensionForce)
        Alter the maximum force exerted by this wheel's suspension.

        Increase this if your suspension cannot handle the weight of your vehicle.

        Parameters:
        maxSuspensionForce - the desired maximum force (default=6000)
